data.Title: DOJ May Break Up Google
data.Description: The US Department of Justice is considering breaking up Google, potentially separating Android, Chrome, and even Google Ads. Other scenarios include forcing Google to share data with competitors.

data.Title: Bing Was Faster Than Google in 2017, Internal Documents Reveal
data.Description: During the DOJ antitrust trials, a 2017 Google internal document revealed that Bing Search outperformed Google in terms of speed, particularly for mobile searches.

data.Title: Google Gemini Research to Introduce AI-Powered Citations and Links
data.Description: Google is rolling out a new feature for Gemini Search that will provide citations and links to websites within its AI-generated research summaries.

data.Title: Google Hotel Listings Targeted by Hijackers
data.Description: Google hotel listings are being hijacked, with perpetrators adding fake WhatsApp numbers and marking hotels as permanently closed.

data.Title: Publishers Report Positive Q2 Earnings Driven by AI and Ad Market Recovery
data.Description: Publishers are experiencing a positive trend in their second-quarter earnings for 2024, attributed to AI deals and an improved advertising market.

data.Title: Political Ad Spending Boosts Connected TV Market
data.Description: Connected TV (CTV) is emerging as a major beneficiary of increased political ad spending, with publishers, agencies, and ad tech vendors reporting a surge in demand.

data.Title: Criteo Explores Acquisition of Skai to Enhance Retail Media Capabilities
data.Description: Criteo is in talks to acquire Skai (formerly Kenshoo) to bolster its retail media offerings with enhanced measurement capabilities.

data.Title: Google Search Console Recommendations Feature Rolling Out
data.Description: Google has started rolling out a new recommendations feature in Google Search Console, providing website owners with actionable insights to improve their search performance.

data.Title: Ahrefs to Introduce "Patches" Feature for Streamlined Site Audits
data.Description: Ahrefs is developing a "Patches" feature for their Site Audit tool, allowing users to directly address and fix website issues identified during audits.

data.Title: Google's AI Overviews Shift Focus from Reddit to YouTube
data.Description: A recent study reveals that Google's AI search overviews are increasingly favoring YouTube and LinkedIn as sources, while reducing reliance on Reddit.
